description: ink drawing of three chrysanthemum blossoms over an irregular scholar's rock
markings: seals LRC and UC below blossom: [Gyokuran]; [Gion Furyu]
text: Gyokuran was the wife of the great Nanga artist Ike Taiga, an example of whose painting is also on display in this gallery. While Taiga exerted considerable influence on her development as a painter, she advised him on the writing of waka poetry. In this painting, Gyokuran's spirited brushwork brings fresh vitality to the commonly encountered subject of chrysanthemum flowers. Her use of the angled brush, seen in the broad outlining strokes of the rock, recalls one of Taiga's favorite techniques. Nevertheless, the painting has a playful flamboyance unique to Gyokuran.
title: Chrysanthemums
